missions.name: AIM
missions.description: The Aeronomy of Ice in the Mesosphere (AIM) mission studied noctilucent clouds to understand their formation and variability.

missions.name: Aqua
missions.description: Aqua is part of NASA's Earth Observing System, focusing on the Earth's water cycle, including evaporation, precipitation, and the cycling of water.

missions.name: Aura
missions.description: Aura is a satellite mission dedicated to studying the Earth's ozone layer, air quality, and climate.

missions.name: CALIPSO
missions.description: The Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observations (CALIPSO) mission provided data on the vertical distribution of aerosols and clouds.

missions.name: CloudSat
missions.description: CloudSat used radar to observe cloud properties and their effects on climate and weather.

missions.name: ICESat-2
missions.description: The Ice, Cloud, and land Elevation Satellite-2 (ICESat-2) measures the height of Earth's ice, land, and vegetation.

missions.name: Glory
missions.description: Glory was a climate research satellite intended to collect data on aerosols and solar irradiance but failed to reach orbit.

missions.name: NOAA-N Prime
missions.description: NOAA-N Prime (NOAA-19) is a weather satellite that provides data for forecasting and climate research.

missions.name: ICESat
missions.description: The original Ice, Cloud, and land Elevation Satellite (ICESat) measured ice sheet mass balance, cloud and aerosol heights, and land topography.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Terra is a flagship Earth Observing System satellite that monitors Earth's atmosphere, land, and oceans.

missions.name: Aquarius
missions.description: Aquarius measured sea surface salinity to improve understanding of Earth's water cycle and ocean circulation.

missions.name: Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM)
missions.description: GPM provides global precipitation data every 2–3 hours for understanding Earth’s weather and climate systems.

missions.name: Jason
missions.description: The Jason series measured sea surface height to study ocean circulation and climate change.

missions.name: Landsat (LDCM)
missions.description: LDCM (Landsat Data Continuity Mission) continues the Landsat program for Earth surface imaging to monitor climate and land use change.

missions.name: Ocean Surface Topography Mission (OSTM/Jason-2)
missions.description: OSTM extends ocean topography data to support climate research, ocean forecasting, and hurricane intensity prediction.

missions.name: Orbiting Carbon Observatory-2 (OCO-2)
missions.description: OCO-2 tracks global carbon dioxide to help understand sources and sinks and the carbon cycle's role in climate change.

missions.name: SERVIR
missions.description: SERVIR is a joint initiative that helps countries use Earth observation data for climate resilience and disaster risk reduction.

missions.name: SMAP (Soil Moisture Active Passive)
missions.description: SMAP measures global soil moisture and its freeze/thaw state to improve weather forecasting and climate modeling.

missions.name: SORCE (Solar Radiation and Climate Experiment)
missions.description: SORCE measured solar radiation for studying its influence on Earth's climate and atmospheric chemistry.

missions.name: LAGEOS 1 and 2
missions.description: The LAGEOS satellites were designed to provide accurate measurements of the movement of the Earth's tectonic plates, contributing to the study of continental drift and geodynamics.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: The Van Allen Probes explored the Earth's radiation belts to help understand their dynamics and how they affect Earth's magnetic environment, aiding geodynamic research.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System)
missions.description: TDRS provides essential communication support for various geoscience missions, enabling continuous data transmission crucial for geodynamic and Earth science research.

missions.name: Gravity Probe-B
missions.description: Gravity Probe-B tested two unverified predictions of Einstein's general theory of relativity by measuring the warping of space and time around Earth.

missions.name: Gravity Recovery and Climate Experiment (GRACE)
missions.description: GRACE tracked changes in Earth's gravity field to monitor movements of mass within the Earth system, including ice sheets, oceans, and land water storage.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: The Van Allen Probes studied charged particles in Earth's radiation belts, contributing data relevant to understanding gravitational influences on particle motion.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System)
missions.description: TDRS ensures real-time communication for Earth-observing satellites, supporting gravity-related data transmission critical for geophysical studies.

missions.name: CYGNSS (Cyclone Global Navigation Satellite System)
missions.description: CYGNSS uses GPS signal reflections to measure surface wind speed over oceans, improving forecasts of tropical cyclone formation and intensity.

missions.name: GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: GOES satellites provide continuous imagery and atmospheric measurements, enabling real-time tracking and monitoring of hurricanes and severe weather.

missions.name: Hurricanes
missions.description: This NASA program collects and curates data from various missions to improve understanding of hurricane development, dynamics, and forecasting accuracy.

missions.name: NPP (Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership)
missions.description: Suomi NPP provides critical weather and climate data, including measurements used for hurricane forecasting, sea surface temperatures, and cloud properties.

missions.name: Polar
missions.description: The Polar spacecraft studied Earth's magnetosphere and its interactions with solar wind, contributing to knowledge about space weather impacts on Earth's atmosphere, including hurricane-related dynamics.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Designed to study radiation belts, these probes also provide insight into how solar storms influence Earth's atmosphere and can affect hurricane systems indirectly.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System)
missions.description: TDRS ensures continuous communication between Earth and satellites monitoring hurricanes, enabling near real-time data flow for weather prediction and disaster response.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Terra collects data on Earth's atmosphere, land, and oceans; its instruments support hurricane research through measurements of cloud properties, temperature, and aerosols.

missions.name: Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM)
missions.description: TRMM observed precipitation in tropical regions and provided critical data on rainfall patterns inside hurricanes, improving storm models and forecasting.

missions.name: ICESat (Ice, Cloud, and land Elevation Satellite)
missions.description: ICESat measured changes in the mass of ice sheets, glaciers, and sea ice, helping scientists monitor climate change and its impact on Earth's polar regions.

missions.name: Landsat
missions.description: The Landsat program provides continuous Earth imagery used to monitor ice cover, glacier movement, and long-term environmental change in polar regions.

missions.name: LDCM (Landsat Data Continuity Mission, later Landsat 8)
missions.description: LDCM ensures the continuity of the Landsat program and delivers high-resolution data on ice and snow coverage, supporting glaciology and climate research.

missions.name: Operation IceBridge
missions.description: An airborne mission that filled the data gap between ICESat missions, Operation IceBridge provided 3D views of Arctic and Antarctic ice sheets and sea ice thickness.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: While primarily focused on radiation belts, the probes contributed to understanding how solar activity may affect ice and polar atmospheric conditions.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System)
missions.description: TDRS supports real-time communication between ground stations and satellites collecting ice and polar data, ensuring rapid transmission for scientific analysis.

missions.name: Aqua
missions.description: Aqua monitors Earth's water cycle, including soil moisture and vegetation health, using a suite of instruments to collect data on land surface conditions.

missions.name: ICESat (Ice, Cloud, and land Elevation Satellite)
missions.description: Besides monitoring polar ice, ICESat provided precise elevation data useful in assessing forest structure and changes in vegetation coverage.

missions.name: ICESat-2
missions.description: ICESat-2 improved upon its predecessor by providing more detailed elevation and biomass data for monitoring forests and vegetation dynamics.

missions.name: Landsat
missions.description: Landsat’s long-term data archive supports the study of land cover and vegetation change, urban growth, deforestation, and agricultural monitoring.

missions.name: LDCM (Landsat Data Continuity Mission, later Landsat 8)
missions.description: LDCM continued Landsat's legacy by capturing high-resolution multispectral data for land use, vegetation, and environmental change analysis.

missions.name: NPP (Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership)
missions.description: NPP provides data on vegetation productivity, land surface temperature, and vegetation index trends to support land and ecosystem research.

missions.name: Operation IceBridge
missions.description: Although focused on polar ice, IceBridge also gathered valuable terrain elevation data that aids in studying land topography and vegetation structure.

missions.name: Orbiting Carbon Observatory-2 (OCO-2)
missions.description: OCO-2 tracks carbon dioxide in Earth's atmosphere, supporting studies on photosynthesis and how vegetation affects carbon cycling on land.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Though not directly focused on vegetation, their measurements help understand solar influences that may indirectly affect Earth's land systems.

missions.name: Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM)
missions.description: SRTM created a high-resolution topographic map of Earth, aiding vegetation mapping, forest management, and land use planning globally.

missions.name: SMAP (Soil Moisture Active Passive)
missions.description: SMAP measures soil moisture and freeze-thaw state, crucial for monitoring vegetation health, agriculture, and ecosystem dynamics.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System)
missions.description: TDRS ensures real-time data relay from Earth-observing satellites, supporting land and vegetation studies with timely data delivery.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Terra monitors land surface conditions, vegetation cover, and thermal emissions, supporting a wide range of environmental and ecological studies.

missions.name: Aqua
missions.description: Studies Earth's water cycle including oceans, atmosphere, and land.

missions.name: Aquarius
missions.description: Mapped sea surface salinity to study ocean circulation and climate.

missions.name: Jason-1
missions.description: Monitored global ocean surface topography and sea level.

missions.name: NOAA-N Prime
missions.description: Monitored oceanic and atmospheric conditions for weather forecasting.

missions.name: Ocean Surface Topography Mission (OSTM)/Jason-2
missions.description: Continued ocean topography measurements started by Jason-1.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: While not ocean-focused, it provides space weather data influencing Earth’s magnetosphere and indirectly affecting ocean-based measurements.

missions.name: RapidScat
missions.description: Measured ocean surface wind speed and direction to support weather forecasting and climate studies.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite)
missions.description: Enables near-continuous communication with Earth-observing satellites like ocean missions.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Monitors ocean color, temperature, and productivity as part of Earth system science.

missions.name: TOPEX/Poseidon
missions.description: Revolutionized oceanography by precisely measuring sea surface height.

missions.name: Aura
missions.description: Monitors ozone, air quality, and climate change with a suite of atmospheric chemistry instruments.

missions.name: NOAA-N Prime
missions.description: Collects ozone and atmospheric data to support weather forecasting and environmental monitoring.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Though not ozone-specific, it provides insights into space weather which can affect upper atmospheric composition including ozone.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite)
missions.description: Enables communication with Earth-observing satellites monitoring ozone and atmospheric dynamics.

missions.name: TOMS-EP (Total Ozone Mapping Spectrometer - Earth Probe)
missions.description: Focused on monitoring global ozone levels and detecting the ozone hole.

missions.name: Upper Atmosphere Research Satellite (UARS)
missions.description: Studied ozone layer and other atmospheric variables to understand the upper atmosphere's chemistry and dynamics.

missions.name: Aqua
missions.description: Aqua collects data about Earth's water cycle including precipitation, evaporation, and the cycling of water vapor, with instruments like MODIS and AMSR-E.

missions.name: ATTREX (Airborne Tropical Tropopause Experiment)
missions.description: Investigates the transport of water vapor and other chemicals in the upper atmosphere to improve climate models and understanding of the water cycle.

missions.name: GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: Provides continuous observations of weather systems and supports monitoring of atmospheric water vapor and cloud development.

missions.name: NPP (Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership)
missions.description: Measures key climate variables including precipitation and water vapor to support weather forecasting and climate research.

missions.name: POES (Polar Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: Provides global data on temperature, humidity, and cloud cover to monitor the Earth's water cycle and support weather forecasting.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Focused on space weather, it indirectly contributes to understanding Earth's atmospheric dynamics and energy transfers that influence the water cycle.

missions.name: SMAP (Soil Moisture Active Passive)
missions.description: Measures soil moisture and freeze-thaw state to provide insights into water availability, droughts, and global water cycle trends.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite)
missions.description: Supports continuous data communication for satellites monitoring the Earth's hydrological systems and weather phenomena.

missions.name: Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM)
missions.description: Provided detailed observations of tropical rainfall and its role in the global water cycle and energy exchange.

missions.name: ATTREX (Airborne Tropical Tropopause Experiment)
missions.description: Studied the composition and chemistry of the tropical tropopause to better understand climate change and atmospheric dynamics.

missions.name: GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: Provides real-time weather data, storm tracking, and forecasting tools for the U.S. and Western Hemisphere.

missions.name: NOAA-N
missions.description: Part of the POES series, it monitored weather, ocean, and atmospheric data to support forecasting.

missions.name: NOAA-N Prime
missions.description: Continued the NOAA-N mission, collecting critical weather and climate data for Earth observation.

missions.name: NPP (Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership)
missions.description: Bridges NASA and NOAA satellite missions, monitoring weather, atmosphere, and climate with advanced instruments.

missions.name: POES (Polar Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: A series of satellites providing global data for long-term weather forecasting and climate research.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Supports weather models by monitoring space weather that influences Earth's magnetosphere and upper atmosphere.

missions.name: SERVIR
missions.description: Uses satellite data to improve environmental decision-making and weather-related disaster preparedness in developing regions.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite)
missions.description: Provides near-continuous communication for weather satellites and atmospheric monitoring missions.

missions.name: Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission (TRMM)
missions.description: Studied tropical rainfall to improve forecasting of hurricanes, floods, and severe storms.

missions.name: Fire and Smoke
missions.description: NASA’s wildfire research focuses on observing fires and smoke from space to improve forecasting and study their impact on air quality and climate.

missions.name: GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites)
missions.description: Provides real-time imagery and data to detect wildfires, monitor smoke movement, and support emergency response.

missions.name: Landsat
missions.description: Captures high-resolution satellite imagery for tracking wildfire progression, assessing damage, and mapping land cover changes.

missions.name: LDCM (Landsat Data Continuity Mission)
missions.description: Continues Landsat's mission to collect essential data on land use, wildfires, and environmental changes.

missions.name: Earth Observing-1 (EO-1)
missions.description: Tested advanced imaging technologies for wildfire detection, including hyperspectral and thermal imaging.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes (Radiation Belt Storm Probes)
missions.description: Primarily studies space weather, but supports understanding of Earth’s atmospheric conditions which may interact with wildfire activity.

missions.name: TDRS (Tracking and Data Relay Satellite)
missions.description: Ensures continuous data relay for Earth observation satellites monitoring wildfires and related phenomena.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Carries sensors like MODIS that monitor active fires, burn scars, and vegetation conditions to support wildfire management.

missions.name: CHAMP
missions.description: CHAMP (Challenging Minisatellite Payload) was a German satellite launched to study Earth's gravity and magnetic fields, and atmospheric conditions.

missions.name: Earth Radiation Budget Satellite (ERBS)
missions.description: ERBS measured the energy radiated by Earth and its atmosphere to study climate change and ozone depletion.

missions.name: Explorer 1
missions.description: Explorer 1 was the first satellite launched by the United States, initiating the Explorer program.
missions.owner: U.S. Army Ballistic Missile Agency / NASA

missions.name: FAST
missions.description: FAST (Fast Auroral Snapshot Explorer) studied auroras and plasma processes in Earth's magnetosphere.

missions.name: Geotail
missions.description: Geotail explored the structure and dynamics of the magnetotail and solar wind interaction.

missions.name: Hinode (Solar-B)
missions.description: Hinode studied the magnetic fields of the Sun to understand solar flares and coronal mass ejections.

missions.name: IMAGE
missions.description: IMAGE (Imager for Magnetopause-to-Aurora Global Exploration) provided the first comprehensive global view of the plasma in Earth's magnetosphere.

missions.name: IRIS: Interface Region Imaging Spectrograph
missions.description: IRIS observes the Sun's interface region to improve understanding of solar wind and its interaction with the solar atmosphere.

missions.name: Polar
missions.description: Polar explored the Sun's polar regions and helped understand the causes of auroras and geomagnetic storms.

missions.name: Van Allen Probes/Radiation Belt Storm Probes
missions.description: The Van Allen Probes studied the Earth's radiation belts, providing insights into space weather and the effects of solar wind.

missions.name: RHESSI
missions.description: RHESSI observed solar flares and high-energy solar phenomena, contributing to understanding solar activity.

missions.name: SDO: Solar Dynamics Observatory
missions.description: SDO observes the Sun to understand the solar atmosphere and its effects on space weather and Earth.

missions.name: SOHO: Solar and Heliospheric Observatory
missions.description: SOHO observes the Sun's interior, atmosphere, and solar wind to improve understanding of solar dynamics.

missions.name: SAMPEX: Solar Anomalous and Magnetospheric Particle Explorer
missions.description: SAMPEX studied charged particles in space and their influence on space weather and Earth's magnetosphere.

missions.name: SORCE: Solar Radiation and Climate Experiment
missions.description: SORCE measured the Sun's radiation output and its impact on Earth's climate and atmosphere.

missions.name: STEREO
missions.description: STEREO provided the first 3D images of the Sun and its atmosphere, contributing to understanding of solar activities and space weather.

missions.name: TDRS
missions.description: The TDRS series provides critical data relay support for NASA's space missions and is vital for maintaining communication with spacecraft.

missions.name: Terra
missions.description: Terra monitors Earth's climate and environmental changes, providing essential data for understanding the Earth's systems and human impacts.

missions.name: THEMIS
missions.description: THEMIS studies the Earth's magnetosphere, specifically auroras and magnetic storms, providing new insights into space weather.

missions.name: TIMED
missions.description: TIMED measures the upper atmosphere and its interactions with solar radiation, improving understanding of atmospheric dynamics and climate.

missions.name: TRACE
missions.description: TRACE provided high-resolution images of the Sun's corona and magnetic fields, helping to understand solar flares and coronal mass ejections.

missions.name: Ulysses
missions.description: Ulysses studied the Sun's polar regions, providing key data on solar wind, cosmic rays, and the Sun's magnetic field.

missions.name: WIND
missions.description: WIND provides detailed measurements of the solar wind, helping scientists understand space weather and its impact on Earth.
